meanings.sent1: She unclamps the lid of the jar to open it.
meanings.sent2: He unclamps the bike from the rack after his ride.
meanings.sent3: The magician unclamps the chains with a flick of his wrist.
meanings.sent4: As the sun sets, nature unclamps its hold on the day.
meanings.sent5: With a satisfying click, she unclamps the seatbelt and steps out of the car.

meanings.definition: To loosen or undo clamps on (something)
meanings.sent1: The mechanic unclamps the hose to check for leaks.
meanings.sent2: After the project is done, he unclamps the workbench for storage.
meanings.sent3: The child pretends to be a superhero who can unclamps any obstacle in his way.
meanings.sent4: With determination, she unclamps the doubts that held her back.
meanings.sent5: The wind unclamps the sails, propelling the boat forward with ease.
